page.title: 15Baxters
page.content: From the humble origins of a small kitchen where{Margaret Baxter made too much jam and sold the surplus in the village,through{1868}when a small grocery shop was opened selling jams and jellies,moving in{1914}to the present site just West of the River Spey,{Baxters}now occupy an extensive factory producing over 100 different varieties of fine Scottish foods. Having supplied the Royal household at Balmoral from 1921 the firm received the Royal warrent in 1960. The present workforce of 550,using highly mechanised methods still make jams and marmalades in small copper pans which hold only 120 jars and to the original recipies now produce an annual turnover of Â£15 million. The factory is now high on the itinery of the many visitors to the North of Scotland.
